meanings.sent1: The teacher will preshow the experiment to the students.
meanings.sent2: She always preshows the latest movie trailers before the main feature.
meanings.sent3: The magician preshowed the disappearing act with a small trick.
meanings.sent4: The preshowing of the painting hinted at the artist's talent.
meanings.sent5: The preshowing of the fireworks amazed the audience.

meanings.definition: The act of showing or displaying something before it happens.
meanings.sent1: The preshowing of the play gave the audience a sneak peek.
meanings.sent2: Attending the preshowing of the fashion line was exciting.
meanings.sent3: The preshowing of the dessert menu made everyone eager for the meal.
meanings.sent4: The preshowing of the new technology left everyone in awe.
meanings.sent5: The preshowing of the art exhibition drew a large crowd.
